ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This is a really great and challenging class! I learned a lot about how to design strong molecular biology experiments and different experimental techniques, how to analyze data, and how to read a paper and not just understand its conclusions, but also be able to pinpoint its flaws.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think a weakness is that the first half of the course is very interactive, while the second half isn't. I liked the interactive nature of the first half and it definitely helped me learn more. Another weakness is I felt like the feedback on my reading responses didn't actually help me improve at all, and I actually got no feedback for the majority of the responses I submitted.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this to undergrads who have taken MB&B 301 and are prepared for a similar class that is equally challenging but with slightly more generous grading. This class requires a deceptive amount of effort which is hard to tell from the syllabus but you get a lot out of it, especially if you're considering a career in molecular biology research.
